metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4536 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The client in OpenAFS before 1.6.17 does not properly initialize the (1) AFSStoreStatus, (2) AFSStoreVolumeStatus, (3) VldbListByAttributes, and (4) ListAddrByAttributes structures, which might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive memory information by leveraging access to RPC call traffic.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4536` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent2 - 1.6.17-1
libafsrpc2 - 1.6.17-1
libkopenafs2 - 1.6.17-1
openafs-client - 1.6.17-1
openafs-dbserver - 1.6.17-1
openafs-fileserver - 1.6.17-1
openafs-fuse - 1.6.17-1
openafs-krb5 - 1.6.17-1
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.6.17-1
openafs-modules-source - 1.6.17-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.17-1').
